units.title: Cell and bead co-encapsulation in DisCo
units.text: We found that on average, 91.4% of all droplets contain a cell and a bead, and only 1.7% contain an independent cell doublet (Fig. 1f).
units.rationale: This is a quantified, actionable step describing the efficiency of cell-bead co-encapsulation in the DisCo system.

units.title: Cell capture efficiency measurement
units.text: We processed cell numbers of between 50 and 200 cells, of which 74.9% (s.d. ±10.7%) of input cells had more than 500 unique molecular identifiers (UMIs) per cell (Fig. 1j).
units.rationale: This describes a specific experimental protocol for measuring cell capture efficiency based on UMI thresholds.

units.title: DisCo processing speed at different cell concentrations
units.text: At a higher cell concentration of 20 cells per μl, the processing speed could be increased to 350 cells per hour, although with a decreased capture efficiency of approximately 75%.
units.rationale: This provides a direct operational parameter for adjusting processing speed and efficiency based on cell concentration.

units.title: Impedance measurement for input cell counting
units.text: We quantified the number of input cells using impedance measurements, which enabled accurate counting of the number of input cells as validated by microscopy (Extended Data Fig. 2f).
units.rationale: This is a validated methodological step for quantifying input cell numbers prior to processing.

units.title: Species mixing experiment for library quality
units.text: Initially, as a library quality measure, we performed a species mixing experiment of human embryonic kidney (HEK) 293T and murine immortalized brown pre-adipocyte (IBA) cells.
units.rationale: This describes a specific quality control protocol using species mixing to assess library integrity.

units.title: Droplet generation and valve actuation
units.text: The important points are the implementation of Quake-style microvalves to facilitate flow control during operation; the development of a machine-vision-based approach utilizing subsequent image subtraction for blob detection; the induction of deterministic particle displacement patterns to move particles into the target region of interest with 95.9% of particles placed in a ~200-μm-wide region; and the precise pressurization of the dropleting valve to enable accurate control of droplet volume.
units.rationale: This summarizes key operational steps for controlling droplet generation and particle positioning in the DisCo system.

units.title: Time-dependent cell stress assessment
units.text: We also assessed time-dependent effects on the quality of the single cell data by analyzing HEK 293T cells that were loaded on our system (at 22 °C (room temperature)) for 0–20, 20–40 and 40–60 min. Furthermore, we sampled cells that were stored for 120 and 180 min on ice.
units.rationale: This outlines a protocol for evaluating the impact of processing time and storage conditions on cell quality.

units.title: Comparison with Fluidigm C1 platform
units.text: We chose the 96-trap chip given that, according to the user manual, it is the more suitable chip for low cell inputs. We found that the Fluidigm C1 system achieves absolute processing efficiencies between 30% and 45% (Extended Data Fig. 2g), matching the performance listed by the manufacturer for the 215-cell condition.
units.rationale: This describes a direct comparative benchmarking protocol using a competitor system under defined conditions.

units.title: Chip-based cDNA generation protocol
units.text: With the drastically reduced bead amounts contained in the generated sample emulsion, we used our previously developed and characterized chip-based complementary DNA generation protocol.
units.rationale: This specifies the use of a defined protocol for cDNA generation tailored to DisCo's low-bead environment.

units.title: Barcode merging for low-bead samples
units.text: We were able to identify and merge closely related barcodes (described in Methods) without compromising single cell purity (Extended Data Fig. 2b,c).
units.rationale: This describes a specific bioinformatic protocol enabled by DisCo's low bead count and validated for purity.
